document_data.name: A Tour of Tempest
document_data.mainbody:
'''''A Tour of Tempest''''' was an [[Umberlant]] [[book]] that discussed the [[divine]] [[tempest domain]], written by and published sometime in or before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Aye, how Queen Umberlee and Lord Talos fight and fray over its dominion... but even they, even They On High know in truth Tempest can never be tamed, only... channelled... by the favored few. Reach up thy hands to the sky, outstretched awaiting breath of gods to blast thee oblivious, supplicate and ask to be drowned, to be blown asunder, to be destroyed... or perhaps, perhaps, to be granted such might to speak the words of Talos with thine own sweet hand...''|Excerpt from ''A Tour of Tempest''}}
document_data.Content: ''A Tour of Tempest'' was a large tome the size of an encyclopedia. The book's writing style was wild with its content being sometimes hard to understand.
document_data.History: A copy of ''A Tour of Tempest'' could be found in the {{YearlinkName|1492}} in [[Water Queen's House]], a temple dedicated to [[Umberlee]] located in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
